Buono's has taken a turn for the worse the service is  the food is worse!!!! I complained to the owner Juan  and he basically told me he doesn't care I can deal with it! I have been coming here 15 years and ever since Jimmy sold the place it's gone to Shit! 
Vic would be ashamed of what they have done!
Been coming to buonos pizza my whole life, stopped in today since it's been awhile and was blown away how rude the cashier was. It was incredible, she obviously hated her job. I won't be coming back.

I used to love their white pizza but it started to come out tasting old and stale a few months back. I only eat it when I order a whole pie because then it's fresh and as delicious as ever. Their wings are pretty good and the zeppolis (sp?) are amazing. Food comes up relatively quickly and the employees are nice.
they have great pizza and pizza and wing specials.  I've been here at least once a week for about 4 weeks.  I only order the cheese pizza. Not the most upbeat of folks but the pizza is good.

Ugh, I just made my first Yelp retraction.  I wrote a review of Buono's right before they switched over to new management.  When I got the text from a friend, a twice a week customer to Buono's that they switched owners and the food is now garbage... it was like a family member died.  We had our daughters birthday here, our son and I used to go to lunch here every Saturday.... This was our family establishment.  

Sure enough my family had to try the food with the new ownership.  The pizza was garbage.  It was cheapened up... how could it be?  I was in denial.  Maybe it was an off night.  That's allowed right?  So we tried it again, this time I didn't even want to eat pizza.  I tried the meatball parm sammy (which was always my go to meal) it was horrible.  Soggy bread with tasteless meatballs... what struck me the most was this was a Friday night... it was a ghost town!  Two tables sitting at 6:30 and a 20 minute wait for the pizza.  Back in the day on a Friday night, the place was packed and an hour wait for the pizza.  

Well, it looks like I am back to square one.  I need to find a pizza place.  I am so  bummed that a place I gave 2 five star reviews now get's 1 star.  Gone are the days....
Soggy pizza and greasy wings. First and last time. Staff was nice. Good just not impressive.

I've been going to Buono's for about 10 years now and absolutely loveD it. I don't know if ownership or management changed, but it isn't as good as it used to be for some reason.  Buono's is located in a shabby shopping center right next to a Goodwill, so don't expect it to be posh. It has low-end vinyl flooring and cheap tables.  There are all kinds of tacky "New York" decorations.  None of that mattered though because the pizza and wings were soooo good.  At least, they were.  The crumbly italian sausage was the absolute best around. The sausage isn't like the fake Jimmy Dean you see at most pizza places, it is larger and seems like it is shaved off a big hunk of sausage. The sausage isn't as good as it used to be, but it is still quite good and I would recommend it. I don't know why the sausage, and the pizza as a whole as a result, isn't as good, but something is just different about it.  I still like Buonos, I just don't love it anymore.
shitty pizza.. shittier customer service.. do your self a favor and order from Big Boy's. Bitch.. I am a customer. Don't get all snotty with me on the phone for asking questions about your specials.
I agree with the 2 stars. Used to be great. We tried numerous times to order by phone and no one answers!! Go there and it's just as bad. Can't believe they'd be that poorly managed.

On our way to Oregano's & decided to give this place a try. 7:30 on a Tuesday night. The dining room is empty except for the one man waiting for his to-go order. My son & I sit and peruse the menu. The only visible waitress is busy mopping the floor. She takes a break and asks us for our drink order. My drink shows up with some foreign film floating on top. Yuk. I call the waitress over and she sees the film and offers to bring me a new drink. Which she does, only it's in a styrofoam cup. I guess they determined that the film came from the cup so it was better to give me a styrofoam replacement even though there was no film in my sons drink. Our waitress tells us that the large cheese pizza's are $2 off tonight. Yeah, a deal. We checked out the menu and decided on an order of meatballs ($5) and a large sausage pizza ($13.49 - $2).
Meatballs: tough & small. Nothing like the picture in the menu. 3 small meatballs for $5 is not a good deal. The marinara sauce was good however.
Pizza: The sausage had a nice flavor and there was plenty on the pie. The cheese & sauce were good as well. Nothing blowing me out of the water but fine. The crust, hmm, let's just say if you looked at the pie from the bottom you would never be able to tell it was cooked.
Now I have to get a little picky. First, we had to ask for silverware, twice. The first time was when a cook delivered our meatballs. We didn't have any way to eat them so we asked our server for some silverware and she promptly brought us one set of silverware. I guess she figured my son and I would share the fork. Which we did. When she brought the pizza out we asked for another setup which she promptly brought to our table. Then we had to ask for plates. Our waitress brought us paper plates. This is my second issue; Paper plates. Really? We're dining IN not heading out for a picnic. I really hope this isn't standard issue.
Management take notice: Train your staff. This was ridiculous. After we had placed our order she should have brought us everything we were going to need, i.e. Plates, napkins, silverware, parmesan cheese, pepper flakes etc... She also took FOREVER to pick up our bill. It sat on the tray for over 10 minutes while she walked by numerous times dealing with other guests.
The thing is, good pizza places are a dime a dozen. I know this place has been here a long time but that's the problem. The kinks should have been worked out by now. There are just too many pizza joints within 3 miles in any direction that do a better job.
North - Oreganos, Big Boys
East - Barro's, Old Chicago, Nello's or Rosati's
South - Fired Pie, Pesto's
West - Classic Italian, Rosati's, Rigatony's, Miele's, Barro's
I chose this place because I had heard good things about it. I'm glad I checked it out but now having eaten there I wish we had continued on to Oregano's.
The pizza we had was very greasy. server was nice but I'm rating it on the food and I just can't do more than 2 stars because it was too greasy.

I came here for lunch with 2 other Yelp friends. We shared an extra large Neapolitan pizza with 4 toppings. This was a 20" pizza with a thin NY style crust. The waitress who took our order was soft spoken and hard to understand. She was very pleasant and attentive. The pizza sauce had a nice flavor. As we removed a couple pieces there was a layer of grease under the crust.The crust needed Viagra. It was limp. It took both hands to pick it up without loosing all the toppings. I would have liked a fork, but they there were no utensils to be found. Maybe they were paying homage to the Renaissance festival. They also broke out the fine china. We were given 4 paper plates with our pizza.  

I must point out that the service was prompt. We had our pizza quickly. I didn't have time to read all of the NY Yankee memorabilia hanging on every square inch of every wall. This place would have been rated lower, except this is a real good tasting pizza.
I've been going to Buonos since I was in High School at Dobson. I love this side Pizza joint. great food. the staff is kind of friendly but it's that brooklyn attitude that makes em shine.

Great little place, authentic NY style pizza. Our server was very friendly and attentive. Strangely enough they ran out of sausage! That didn't make the pizza any worse for wear, it was still really good! I'll definately be back.

I have been a customer for 20 years now.  I moved from the east valley years ago and really miss the food. I do know they have had new owners in the last ten years or so and had heard it wasn't the same. I was happy to revisit Buonos last month before an author visit at Changing Hands. Still great! One of the best NY pizza places in town. YUM! If you like that oil on top, greasy NY slice type of pizza then Buonos is for you. Manga!
I don't know what happened.  The first time I went here, OMG! , the  pizza was to die for, but when I returned, it became worse.  Greasy enough for Alabama ashy legs. Sorry Bunos's
